mcpSettings.description: Production MCP setup - 6 MCPs for development, testing, and AI assistance

builtInTools: Use Read/Write/Edit for files (not filesystem MCP)
Use Bash for git commands (not git MCP)
Use WebSearch for research (not brave-search MCP)
Use WebFetch for web pages (not fetch MCP)

whenToUseMCPs.memory: Store/recall architectural decisions, past bug fixes, project context
whenToUseMCPs.sequential-thinking: Only for very complex reasoning (costs ~$0.10 per 32K tokens)
whenToUseMCPs.playwright: E2E testing with accessibility tree, automated UI testing
whenToUseMCPs.context7: Get live documentation for React, Electron, Drizzle, TypeScript, any library
whenToUseMCPs.github: GitHub API operations (requires GITHUB_TOKEN) - issues, PRs, repos
whenToUseMCPs.puppeteer: Browser automation, scrape UK legal sites (legislation.gov.uk, caselaw.nationalarchives.gov.uk)

githubOperations: Option 1: Use github MCP (requires GITHUB_TOKEN env var)
Option 2: Use Bash tool with gh CLI:
beforeCommit: Run pnpm lint:fix for ESLint auto-fixes
Run pnpm type-check for TypeScript validation
Run pnpm test for unit test verification
Use mcp__memory to store architectural decisions
testingWorkflow: Use playwright MCP for E2E tests (accessibility-based, no screenshots)
Use puppeteer MCP for browser automation and web scraping
playwright is faster and more reliable for structured UI testing
puppeteer is better for dynamic content and JavaScript-heavy sites
